content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. The salary of the Vice President is adjusted annually based on comparability payments made to General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The Vice President's salary is adjusted annually based on comparability payments to General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is made before any other adjustments and remains in effect until the comparability payment it was based on is terminated or superseded. Amendments are made to Section 104 of title 3 and Section 5318 of title 5, United States Code. Amendments to Section 5318 of title 5, United States Code involve adjusting the annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions based on comparability payments to General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100 and remains in effect until the corresponding percentage adjustment is terminated or superseded. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule positions is adjusted based on comparability payments to General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is treated as the annual rate of pay for the positions involved, and it remains in effect until the corresponding percentage adjustment is terminated or superseded. The Executive Schedule positions' annual pay rate is adjusted based on comparability payments to General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment remains in effect until terminated or superseded. Amendments have been made to Section 5318 of title 5, United States Code, to reflect these changes. Amendments are made to increase maximum rates of basic pay for specific positions in the judicial branch. References to level IV of the executive schedule are changed to level III in certain sections. This includes positions covered by section 604(a)(5) of title 28, circuit executives, and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. Amendments to the Office of the United States Courts Personnel Act of 1990 increase maximum pay rates for specific judicial branch positions. References to level IV of the executive schedule are changed to level III in certain sections, including positions in the administrative office of the United States courts. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
